Title: Object: Baths of Cleopatra, at Alexandria
Series: Views in Egypt, Palestine and other parts of the Ottoman Empire
Description: Plate 15 in volume I: view of a bay; in the foreground, two men with turbans walking the beach towards a cave on the left where four men standing, three men in a boat on the right; two slipways on the other side of the bay where more figures standing; boats in the sea and another land in the left background; after Mayer; published state. 1802 Hand-coloured aquatint with etching
Curator's comments: The series was published in three volumes by Robert Bowyer in 1804, for Sir Robert Ainslie who possessed the original drawings by Luigi Mayer. The subject of the first volume was views in Egypt, the second in Palestine, the third in Caramania, a part of Asia Minor, and some other islands and cities. The plates are dated between 1801 and 1803.
Bibliographic references: Abbey Travel / Travel in Aquatint and lithography 1770-1860 from the library of J.R.Abbey (369.I.15)
